titlestmt.titleproper: RG 074:004, Irene Mix Root Genealogical Papers
titlestmt.subtitle: Inventory
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Connecticut State Library staff.

publicationstmt.p: Copyright Â© 2009 by the Connecticut State Library

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Paul E. baran on July 15, 2008

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: Irene Mix Root (1887-1949) was the genealogist for the Colonial Dames Society. These papers contain her genealogy notes and register files.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Irene Howe Mix was born in New Haven on August 7, 1887, to Alfred and Anna Mix. Mix was on the staff of the Connecticut State Library as the secretary to Lucius B. Barbour, the Public Records Examiner. In 1933, she became the genealogist for the Colonial Dames Society. She married Judson Buel Root on September 25, 1935. Besides the Colonial Dames, Root belonged to the Ruth Wyllys Chapter, Daughters of the American Revolution and the Society of Mayflower Descendents. She died on October 16, 1949.
Sources: Hartford Courant, September 26, 1935, p. 13; Hartford Courant, October 17. 1949, p.4.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: These papers consist of the genealogical notes amassed by Root while the genealogist for the Colonial Dames. There are 80 notebooks with a card file index. Family names from the index are transcribed in the Container List below. The notes primarily cover the 18thcentury. There are also working papers for the Colonial Dames register.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Family names in the notebooks are in no particular order. The index identifies which books the name could be found in. The register sheets are arranged alphabetical by last name.

controlaccess.head: Organizations:
controlaccess.corpname: National Society of the Colonial Dames of America in the State of Connecticut

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: These records are stored at an off-site facility and therefore may not be available on a same-day basis.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: Recieved from Irene Mix Root's estate on November 30, 1949.

scopecontent.p:
The following index to the notebooks was transcribed from the card index file in Box 6. The cards also refer to Files 1, 2 and 3, the location of which are unknown. Therefore that information is not transcribed here. The numbers following the names refer to the book number in which the name is found.
